website_summaries.verdict: Excellent recreational baseball glove that works for playing multiple defensive positions.
pros: Adjustable fit with Velcro strap near the wrist
Has a closed basket-style web, so even pitchers can use this glove, but it's large enough for outfielders and first basemen
Break-in process doesn't take as long as some other gloves
cons: Not made for daily use or highly competitive league play

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent glove!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 37 years old and my son is just getting into baseball. I needed a new glove so we could play catch. This is a beautiful glove! It comes pretty broken in and soft. The smell of the leather is heavenly. I used some Wilson Pro Stock glove conditioner on this (three applications) and left it tied up around a ball for a couple of weeks. This broke it in further. I got the all brown version and the fur around the adjustment strap is so comfy. I’m glad I spent a little bit extra and got a good quality glove. Don’t hesitate. I’d highly recommend this glove.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gross

customer_reviews.title: I would say regardless of the money this is one of the finest gloves for any age
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Glove for my 10 yr old son. He is in his 2nd year of LL and needed a real glove going forward. We looked at, an scrutinized dozens of gloves before settling on this Rawlings. I've had my Rawlings for over 30yrs. and this glove meets the same quality and fit as my old one. I hope he has as many fond memories as i do using this glove. I would say regardless of the money this is one of the finest gloves for any age!
customer_reviews.author: CPG167

customer_reviews.title: Nice Glove, But Fatal Flaw
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot to love about this glove. the leather is thick yet supple, and the glove is well padded. The velcro strap is also comfortable. There is however one (fatal?) flaw in the design; inside the thumb area there is a piece of leather that crosses just under the pad of my thumb. It's thick and it's a little irritating and uncomfortable. I'm not sure if this is something that will go away when it's "broken in" but I don't think it will; that peice of leather isn't going to get thinner or softer for a long, long time. I'm not sure if I'll be keeping this glove as a result of this problem.
customer_reviews.author: waetherman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this glove. It fits well, it's ready-to-play, meaning that it is already soft and broken-in enough to use, and overall appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Fenwick

customer_reviews.title: Nice Glove if... you have small hands that don't sweat.
customer_reviews.text: So a size 12 is a pretty standard ADULT INFIELDERS glove size. Now I do not have large hands and I could probably have made this work for an occasional game but. THE INSIDE of the glove is CHEAP VINYL! The place where you need natural breathable leather the most they used very cheap vinyl which means, 1. your hand is gonna start slipping around in sweaty slime and 2. the material will eventually breakdown and start to disintegrate. It's really a shame because it's truly a decent looking glove that works pretty well for quick plays. I really wanted to keep it but I know for sure the interior material is a big problem on hot days.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and materials
customer_reviews.text: Really, just a fantastic glove. Bought one for my 13 year old son, then another for myself a few weeks later. This glove is of the type of quality leather which will likely last me for two decades, if properly oiled. Overall, the glove took about three days of use to break in.
customer_reviews.author: CenAsiaHound

customer_reviews.title: Great glove at a great price
customer_reviews.text: As a competitive softball player for many years using many different gloves, this one is one of my favorites. Came pretty much broken in and game ready - I had to work on it a bit (probably 45 mins) and gave it a liberal coating of shaving cream to help the break in process. After 4 games, this will be my full-time glove at shortstop. Great deep pocket, leather is quality and it's pretty lightweight. Don't spend $150 on another glove when you can buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove!
customer_reviews.text: I had my original glove for 20 years I was very hesitant to make the switch...When this glove arrived I was surprised on how good it was. Great value and very comfortable. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Solid outfielder's glove
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this glove. It is getting increasingly difficult to find brown and tan leather gloves that are timeless. The pocket and palm develop a patina quickly. Takes a bit to break in, as I have had it wrapped for a couple weeks around a ball and play catch a couple times a week with kids and adults. But the pocket has no trouble with softballs. The webbing is great for an outfielder. Can't find much wrong with this glove, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: A Good Glove
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing slow pitch softball for a year with a hard ball glove and unfortunately have dropped a few balls. I went to Amazon and found this glove and ordered it in the 12.5" size. The ad said it was ~80% broken in. Upon receipt, it was soft and pliable. I worked the glove for a day and played with it the next day. It was great. Haven't dropped a ball again!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great mitt, fast break-in, perfect for casual or serious fun.
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with this mitt the minute I put it on. Soft and game-ready after 10 minutes of punching the pocket with my other fist, and pressing it closed between both hands, and a few minutes of playing hard-ball catch with my high-school son. Really, that fast! And it’s a deeper, richer brown than shown. I don’t know how long it will last—-certainly not as long as my $110 Mizuno, nor my $220 All Star, or maybe not much longer than the 2 Shoeless Joe mitts I have—-but surely will last 4 years or so like the last Rawlings I had (which was used heavily in league play).
customer_reviews.author: Sui Juris

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was bigger.
customer_reviews.text: Same high quality glove, basically, I remember from childhood. However, I got the largest fielders glove they offer but it simply isn't large enough on my hand. Sits a tad awkward, but hopefully it will soften enough to be close. It will never fit completely as my thumb is simply too long for it. Shame thy don't make it easier to actually size mitts. The mitt itself is actually big enough, the stitching and strap on the thumb could be changed to accommodate larger hands.
customer_reviews.author: jacob vance

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent glove but mine seemed to be damaged upon receipt.
customer_reviews.text: Thumb side of glove was bent outwards, which didn't allow the glove to properly create a large pocket. Honestly, I'm not sure if it was just a bad glove, or if the design of the glove resulted in this defect. Attractive look, but the leather in the H web was stretched out as well. Made in Vietnam (that's a plus over China as far as I'm concerned). No bad smells, comfortable and well-fitting otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: kev

customer_reviews.title: good return service
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a Christmas present. Was smaller than I expected. With little time before Christmas, I bought a bigger glove at a local store. The seller was gracious to fully refund the returned item, which was never opened from its sealed, plastic bag. As with most gloves, I was also disappointed that the glove was tough and slick, and I found one I that felt more worn-in or ready for play. I've always like gloves with the big holes in the web, for viewing through the web, like this one, while catching high flies or line drives.
customer_reviews.author: J. Guenther

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.  Maybe a little small
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to get a glove to play catch with my grandson, but one that once he grew out of his beginner glove I could pass it on to him. I think this will do the trick. It's a little stiff, but that will easily be broken in with us playing catch. It's all leather and looks to be well made. Here's to some special times with my grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Whitehurst

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended and recommend!!! Read details
customer_reviews.text: Love the glove, the only issue is on my left hand (right hand orientation) knuckle (ring finger) there is some kind of protrusion sticking down inside the glove on top of my knuckle that make playing with the glove uncomfortable after a while making me have to take a brake and switch gloves. I am hoping that after I finish breaking in the glove this issue will elevate itself. It feels like the leather is not sitting right!? With that being said I would recommend this glove, everything else about this glove is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Concerned consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy to find that this catcher's mitt did not take multiple seasons to get broken in enough to use. The leather was quite soft and the mitt overall was pliable upon delivery. I applied a liberal amount of oil could turn it inside out almost immediately. That, combined with a 100 or so pops with a glove mallet (highly recommend) it was usable in practice for my 10-year-old. After a week or so, he was able to use it in game situations and is having great success.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent glove for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Been using the glove for a few months now. Was super surprised at how soft it was out of the box. I softened it a bit more before use but I don’t think you really need to. It’s very comfy and feels like your old worn in glove from when you were a kid. The 12-3/4 glove is perfect for playing softball with my daughter and also baseball with my son. It flexes well and the pocket forms easy. The fingers feel a bit flattened when my hand is in the glove, but a few squeezes to round them out and it’s fine. Highly recommend this glove, especially after a lot of research and trying on other gloves at Dicks.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty stiff right out of the bag
customer_reviews.text: I just received the glove from Amazon today, and I have not played a game with it yet. Very first impression is that it is very snug in the fingers, and my hands are small. Most importantly, Rawlings says the glove is 80/20 broken in, meaning 80% of the work is done at the factory, and 20% by the owner. That’s nonsense. The glove isn’t stiff as a board, but it sure is not playable out of the bag. I hope there aren’t a lot of balls hit my way for a few games, because this is going to take some work to get ready.
customer_reviews.author: grebd

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mitt! I hadn’t bought a new mitt in over 25 years. I went in to a few local stores but never found anything I liked, not to mention the prices. One day I saw this mitt as a Lightning Deal, so I took a chance. It’s really a beautiful one; soft in the right places and sturdy, too. I still need to put some glove oil on (sold separately), but it’s fun to break-in something new :) I really don’t think you can go wrong with this one. I use it recreationally, playing catch with my kids. My 12-year-old daughter thinks it’s too big for her, but she still tries to steal it! I have the 12.5
customer_reviews.author: A. Wasser

customer_reviews.title: Great with minor issue.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking glove. My only gripe is that it is really stiff between the thumb and index finger and it's pretty distracting. I believe it will get better over time but from the factory it has a fold that just won't work itself out. The rest of the glove is soft and feels broke in like it should. I think it was just folded so long its memory keeps it creased there. I would buy it again. It's a good glove that looks really nice and in time will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Justin from WV

customer_reviews.title: Tight as a drum
customer_reviews.text: Want to play catch with the 3 grandsons so I bought a glove. I’m an average size guy, 5’11”, with average size hands who could hardly get this glove on my hand. The old back of the hand flap with a brass button, gone, too short velcro in its place. What they have added is, what seems like, an additional 10 yards of leather lacing. Then a machine, probably, cinches everything as tight as possible. My five fingered 5 finger glove is more like a first baseman’s mitt than a fielders glove. My advice - go on eBay and find a 30 year old broken in glove.
customer_reviews.author: Lew England

customer_reviews.title: Worst experience buying a glove in my life.
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a good glove so I bought one. I’m right handed so I ordered the “right handed” option. They sent me a glove for the right hand (meaning a left handed player). I figured I didn’t understand the description and ordered the “left handed” option. They sent me another glove to be fit on the right hand. Now I’m two returns in and still no glove. And, to be honest, they felt too snug anyway like they weren’t made large enough for an adult’s hand. 0/10
customer_reviews.author: A. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: 12 1/2" For smaller hand size / strange fit
customer_reviews.text: I wear a men's XL glove and sometimes a large will work. I could barely fit my hand in this glove and the adjustable velcro wrist strap would only overlap by about a 1/2". Fit my wife's wrist perfect but she commented that the palm area was over sized. I returned this item and purchased the Rawlings Sandlot Series 12 3/4" glove which fits perfectly all around with out the adjustable wrist strap. Thanks for all the answers to my question about glove sizing but I didn't want a 14" or 15" glove. If you have a larger hand and want a mid sized all around glove go with the Sandlot Series.
customer_reviews.author: friendly

customer_reviews.title: Best glove over ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Love this glove, got the 14” and feel like I can catch anything that comes close to me. Great leather, great hand protection...no sting however you catch the ball. If I had to pick a fault, it doesn’t fit all the way onto your hand and falls well short of your wrist, feels like you have to push it on your hand from time to time as it’s barley hanging on. But never an incident in this regard, just the way the glove fits. I’m used to older gloves that go all the way to your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbellied1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value
customer_reviews.text: It amazes me that you can spend hundreds of dollars on a glove or mitt, when quality ones are available in this price range. Finally needed to get a real catcher's mitt as my sons pitches were starting to really hurt with a normal glove on my hand. This thing is a lifesaver. Plus, my son's a glove snob and he loves it, too. Glad to have found this, and it really lives up to it's high praise in the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice S.

customer_reviews.title: $60 very well spent
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it was a $60 glove, so my expectations were not that it should have the feel or build quality of a $250 glove. With that being said, I’m extremely pleased. Never played softball and am just getting into the sport. For the casual player, this glove can’t be beat at it’s price point. Played baseball years ago and have owned several higher end Rawlings mitts. This is very comfortable, comes broken in and ready to play. I expect it will soften up as the weeks go by. Solid buy
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove for the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: Listen, I didn’t buy this glove thinking it was a super high end glove. But, I am am very impressed with what I got for my money. As my sons have gotten older , I needed a catchers glove to help out with some pitching in between practices. This glove is great for that! It. My 10 year old just started catching last year, and now that it’s broken in, he can use it this spring if he catches more. Great glove for the money. And not a crazy investment if your player decides to not stick with being a catcher!
customer_reviews.author: Dale H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove for a 10-Year-Old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10-year-old son who plays first base and center field. This is a wonderful all-around mitt. It took about a month for the glove to get broken in enough to where my son felt comfortable playing with it. Prior to breaking it in he had a lot of dropped catches because he couldn't easily close it. The glove is high quality and should last him for another few years before he outgrows it. Good price, great mitt!
customer_reviews.author: ZacAttack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality; A Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: All too many consumer items today are made of inferior materials and lousy workmanship. This Rawlings glove is a rare find: It's very well constructed. For someone new to softball, I spent quite a lot of time admiring its beauty and fit. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy's Mentor

customer_reviews.title: tight fit
customer_reviews.text: I love this glove, good quality in the leather, but the 12.5 inches size glove is made for small hands or youth size. If you're a big guy that usually wears x- large gloves, it will be a tight fit. the 14-inch glove is the one to buy for the adult large hand. It can fit in time with a lot of breaking into to stretch the leather in the finger area.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Chadwell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but too small for me
customer_reviews.text: It is an awesome glove, if my hand was a bit smaller. however, the feel is great, the break-in is close to about 70% done. It is an AWESOME glove. I unfortunately am unable to use it. I would let my kids use it but their hands are too small.. Unfortunately I will have to return the Item. But for those with average sized paws, this is a great deal on a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Best Glove on the market
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these for me and my dad to play catch, and also so I could play ball with my friends. I've used other brands before but these are the most comfortable. They broke in really quick and they feel very sturdy and like they will stand the test of time. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Anguiano

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price point, don't worry if it's tight at first
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't played baseball in years and forgot that new gloves feel way too small at first. I'm a 6' tall man so I was thinking maybe I just need a bigger glove. I loosened a couple of the laces, applied some gold glove butter on the whole thing and it's breaking in nicely with use, I didn't need a larger glove. Note: I'm using the 13" with softball and I haven't felt like I need a larger pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Decent glove for recreational play
customer_reviews.text: My previous Rawlings glove died after 20+ years of occasional use each spring when I coach my son's baseball team. So was forced to hunt for a new glove. Have been very happy with this glove so far. Came quite broken in already, but still used some glove conditioner and have loved the feel and flexibility of the glove already. Hoping it lasts me 20 years like my previous glove!
customer_reviews.author: E Bird

customer_reviews.title: Mitt
customer_reviews.text: Good glove, pre-broken in. Expecting it to last for at least a few seasons. I've had 1 or 2 of these types of pre-broken in gloves before. Obviously don't last as long as the actual leather ones you really have to work in, but ready for instant use and a lot cheaper. Definitely would recommend this for recreational ball, maybe even high school ball too, depending on how much you're catching.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: The Original Rawlings Leather Baseball Glove!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the used Rawlings Glove, so I got an incredible amount of quality, soft and comfortable leather for my money! Or maybe just the smell of a solid leather baseball glove brought back fond childhood memories! Quality is as what I remembered..... every stitch and awle hole symmetrically placed... unbroken without a tear! Breaking in the glove is a matter of opinion....I Soaked with Glovolium oil this time....2 bottles worth total! One and half bottles at first to saturate glove and placed softball in my most comfortable spot, wrapped inside a disposable bag and placed it in trunk of hot car for nearly a week playing with occasionally, then reapply to any discolored areas!
customer_reviews.author: Stud Muffin

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove
customer_reviews.text: Nice glove, alittle small, glove comes partially broke in , it's advertised as 80 percent broke in bit is more like 60 percent, it requires break in , not game ready, but after break in , very nice, good leather, nice pocket, but as stated it's alittle small have to force my hand in it , but well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought high school son a premium Rawlings glove, so I figured I would give this cheaper model a try for myself. I have to say it's very comparable to the more expensive version. I have big hands and was needing at least 13" and this fit like a, well, a glove. Very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Miller

customer_reviews.title: but the quality is excellent. Very well made glove
customer_reviews.text: This glove costs far less than most of the Rawlings gloves, but the quality is excellent. Very well made glove. The glove breaks in well, but is very rugged. Could have spent a lot more, but I don't think a more expensive glove would look better or make any difference on the field. A+
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with Rawlings
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many Rawlings gloves through the years, so when it was time to get this catchers glove I didn't hesitate to buy this glove from Amazon. Great quality dark brown leather, and is soft enough to have a minimal break in period. Mine is an adult 33" and fits perfectly. Great quality and great price!
customer_reviews.author: Smash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Craftmanship
customer_reviews.text: Great glove. Just started my summer league and this glove was a great buy. The leather is soft and very real with that great leather smell. It's large but not too large the craftsmanship is EXCELLENT you really feel like they give personal attention to make each glove perfect . I highly recommend this glove!
customer_reviews.author: Mordy Hof

customer_reviews.title: I bought 1 right and 1 left, not the same glove
customer_reviews.text: My partner is left handed, his glove was great. Perfectly broken in and easy to use. I decided to buy myself one, righty. Not the same. Not broken in hardly at all, and very difficult to close. I've played softball my whole life, so it's not an issue with hand strength. If you're a lefty, it's great. If your right handed, be prepared to do some serious breaking in, which sucks because that's why I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: El

customer_reviews.title: Get some oil for it
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent mitt for the price. It's all leather and smells so much like summer to me. Get some oil, warm it up, and put a ball in it overnight. It will be stiff at first, but like a nice pair of leather shoes, the only way to break it in is to use it.
customer_reviews.author: roxykargisize

customer_reviews.title: Not for softball.
customer_reviews.text: This glove is advertised as suitable for slow pitch softball, but the pocket is not deep enough, in my opinion (10 years playing slow pitch). This is especially true as the glove fits small - it is difficult even to close the velcro wrist strap.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great value, excellent build quality, everything I expect from Rawlings.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself, as my 6 year old is in Little League, and I wanted to practice with him. It is advertised as "game ready". It's a little stiff, but I expect that after playing catch a few times and the old rubber bands with balls in the pocket it will break in properly in no time. I got it for $40, which is a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan P.

customer_reviews.title: Not as soft as I was expecting but it catches all the balls
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I got volun-told by my wife I was going to be helping coach softball. This glove is large enough for a12" softball to fit nicely in the pocket. I don't even notice a baseball in it. My only complaint would be that it was stiffer than I expected. Really a minor complaint because little conditioning oil and it was right as rain.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gonzalez II

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for an outfielder! Love it! Oiled her up and breaking her in even more but it’s broke in to the point you can buy it and go play as soon as you get it. Makes it much easier and less planning needed.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Really thin and cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a glove quick and this glove was cheap enough. Flexible out the box, and thin leather. Almost no padding on the palm. Would definitely recommend if you need a cheap glove for occasional use. Definetly not worth using in a tournament or super frequently. If this review was helpful, go ahead and click that button.
customer_reviews.author: MrMurgle

customer_reviews.title: 14 inch glove
customer_reviews.text: this is a big glove, but it's pretty ready for use--i did not particularly like the slightly suede like finish, so i rubbed in some snow seal on the inside and outside, and it really gave it the wax like finish of yesteryear. not as nice as my nokonas, but pretty darn close for about a fourth of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Son likes it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son during his High School season. It was a good thing this mitt is pretty much broken in so my son was able to use it right out of the gate with no worries. He like the feel of it and has so far stood up to the abuse a teenager gives with tossing it around. it will be getting more use out of it come the summer softball league season
customer_reviews.author: ellis b

customer_reviews.title: Small Fit, Not recommended for Adult Male
customer_reviews.text: As stated - not certain if I received a similar styled Youth model, but my 12 1/2 glove did not fit my hand properly at all. The fingers were much too short and the net is very shallow. Essentially was catching balls with my palm alone and it made things quite difficult. Ended up buying a different glove, also by Rawlings from my local Dick's and it fit much better, despite also being a 12 1/2 mitt. I thought I could play through it, otherwise I would of returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly soft and ready to play.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, ultra soft glove and very broken in. Bought this and the Gamer. Leather not as good as Gamer but amazing glove for price. I dunno about beyond just playing catch as thats all we do is father son catch. We trade off and I love this one. Breaking in Gamer will take some additional time. Great backup glove. Amazing for price. Dony hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: rudelini

customer_reviews.title: Rawlings gloves are the best
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a few different brands before settling on Rawlings. This glove is as close to an all leather glove you can get at solid price. Don't settle for cheap pay a little extra because something like this will last forever if you dont "loose" it. Lol
customer_reviews.author: mr man

customer_reviews.title: Great starter mitt, ready to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I remember having to wrap a mitt around a baseball with rubber bands for weeks to break it in, this is soft enough to use right out of the box. Great feel, fits a variety of hand sizes, appears to be very durable. Definitely a solid buy and worth the price and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: Great catchers mitt. So so First baseman glove
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten a first baseman glove and a catcher's mitt. Loved the catcher's mitt. Was not a fan of the first baseman glove. The FB glove had seams in the wrong place which felt weird. The catcher's mitt is great. Easy break in and has a solid weight.
customer_reviews.author: flyerjuls

customer_reviews.title: Great glove ! Good value !
customer_reviews.text: After downsizing my home, I realized my softball gloves were missing.. purchased this glove and I am extremely happy with it. It is definitely a full 12 and 1/2 inch glove. All leather as needed. It came pretty well broken in . I did treat it with some neetsford oil. Ready to go very quickly. For $54 this love is really high quality, do not hesitate to purchase this glove. I have average size hands and the wrist strap was snug but fine. BTW "right orientation means you throw right handed.
customer_reviews.author: Popinator

customer_reviews.title: Great looking Glove
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but hurts my pinky finger and feels small. I'm going to give it a little more time to adjust. I had my other glove for over 20 years. Overall great quality for the money and I like the fact it already wore in a little
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Adult men's size. Medium large hand. Get it broke in nice and it's a great glove. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: SMB4

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove
customer_reviews.text: This is a great glove. We had a hard time finding something of good quality which was reasonably priced at our local sports equipment stores. My son is in a competitive year round league and it has held up well for a year now. Great quality and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Urban

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality glove, soft leather so you can use it right away. The place where you put your hand feels a lil small, but at the same time I don't really know how to adjust it. After wearing it for about 20 mins it loosened up and fits my hand comfortably. I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Young Hecty

customer_reviews.title: Size Smaller than Indicated
customer_reviews.text: The 12 1/2 inch glove measures only 11 1/2 inches, so this glove model runs smaller than other Rawlings gloves. I like the Rawlings brand glove and other than the smaller than expected size, this lives up to the standard.
customer_reviews.author: JeffNJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for price!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing glove for price, was awesome to break in. It was dang near perfectly broke in when we got it, just needed a little extra work. Laces needed to be tightened a bit, but not a huge deal. 100% recommend this if you need a new catchers glove. We got a softball and baseball pitcher in our house and it works perfectly for both.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Woolsey

customer_reviews.title: So Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant on buying a glove online but in this current climate - its the only option. We were SO pleasantly surprised. It was a very soft leather. The finger sleeves needed to be stretched a little so we put some fat crayola markers in them from time to time. My boyfriend was very very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bklyn1715

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit for A Taller than Average 13yr Old
customer_reviews.text: My son plays outfield (typically center field because of his speed and height). He needed a replacement for the glove I had as a kid. He is 13 and about 5'-8" This glove is prefect. Not oversized and not small. Just right for good control and feel. Not soft but not stiff. It took us about 2 weeks to really break-in properly, but is was usable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: John Langsdorf

customer_reviews.title: Long break-in period
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to break in. Tight fit on hand. Once you get pocket broken in, it is an excellent glove if — and only if — ball hits straight into pocket. The fingertips will not hold onto ball well. Will never be game glove but is fine for practice.
customer_reviews.author: L L

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this glove. I used to be a pitcher in high school if you know how it feels to catch a pitch shot back at you then you know the importance of a sturdy and protective glove.
customer_reviews.author: Jolona Martin

customer_reviews.title: This glove is not for fastpitch softball
customer_reviews.text: While looking up their heading stated this was able to be used for girls fastpitch softball when at first look you can see this was a all baseball catchers mitt no way this could be used for girls fastpitch perhaps 10” ball but definitely not 12” which is when this glove would be mostly needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Finally replaced my 20 year old glove w this and SO glad for the upgrade. Fits like a glove- great value for the $$, comfortable w great padding in the palm I’m also a Varsity softball coach - so I get to try a lot of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove, but I think a bit small for softball
customer_reviews.text: The glove is fine and doesn't need a whole lot of breaking in. I wish I would have gotten bigger, however, for softball. I am only 5'6" and this feels small for softball. No way it is sufficient for first base in softball. In in hindsight I would get a 14" for softball. Live and learn. It works fine and it is a nice glove.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even used it yet but I can it’s going to be a great mitt. The leather is legit, I live how it smells. I’m currently on day 2 of breaking it in and it already is softening up nice,
customer_reviews.author: Matty🚒

customer_reviews.title: Very nice glove
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted a glove for my husband to play catch with our boy & it's a great fit. I know gloves are sized for position played, but he's got larger hands and the 14" was a great fit
customer_reviews.author: Cari Higgins

customer_reviews.title: great glove for newbie
customer_reviews.text: Great glove for a beginner. It feels like it's made of heavy material which seems like it will last for a very long time and can potentially be passed down to the next generation.
customer_reviews.author: D Kim

customer_reviews.title: Better then the olden day Rawlings.
customer_reviews.text: At 72, I never thought I would own another glove, let alone a Rawlings like the one I used on a Navy team in 1980. Starting to play in a senior's group and proud to own this glove.
customer_reviews.author: W. MacQuoid

customer_reviews.title: Super Sweet Glove
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son uses the 12” glove and loves it. The glove does require a break-in, but once that’s done, the glove is nice and supple. The color is a beautiful rich brown, and the leather is very solid. The glove is also large enough for me (42 years old.)
customer_reviews.author: A Guy Named Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the12” it’s really too short , the fingers are far apart from the thumb. I found it uncomfortable and although it’s soft it was hard to close. Over all it’s an okay glove. I’m returning and gonna go in person to find the right glove for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Reichley

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my 20 year old glove. I love it. All leather with a great smell. Feels great and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove
customer_reviews.text: Nice glove for someone who wants to throw the ball around from time to time. Seems made well and came fairly broken in. May recommend a conditioner for long term but other than that pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Not as big as I thought it would be, but I like it just fine. It broke in quickly and holds onto everything I can run down.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a real leather mitt
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value at <$50. Just a very basic comfy glove. The suede type leather looks good and seems durable. Broke in very quickly. Haven’t caught hard pitching, it does have decent padding but not super protection, so I’d recommend a padded batting glove at least. However it has a big pocket so you shouldn’t be catching on the palm. The toe is thinner (“LiteToe”) but I don’t think it makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent glove! Great price for a quality item. You get what you pay for with everything. It’s not the Best however, I would say this is one of the best for the price range. No doubt!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: One Big Defect
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very well made glove, BUT the strap was way too short, even at maximum setting I could not close the glove. Contacted Rawlings, returned the glove. Still looking for a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon D

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove, well made, good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice glove to use for recreational play, or for high school baseball. Left hand throw glove is made of quality materials by RAWLINGS, nice “feel”, easily broken in, reasonably priced for the value of the glove.
customer_reviews.author: David Green

customer_reviews.title: Love this Glove!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality glove, and very reasonably priced. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Casinghino

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Way smaller than advertised. Go up at least one if not 2 sizes unless you are a doll.
customer_reviews.author: OneFish

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Rawlings Mitt
customer_reviews.text: Great quality Rawlings mitt. The leather is soft, but not overly processed. It does have an extra pad in the palm that I am still getting used to. Given time and care to break it in, this glove should be great for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: EmedChicago

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong hand orientation
customer_reviews.text: Received a right hand glove instead of a left hand glove. This is very annoying considering the amount of time searching for a decent priced/quality left-handed glove
customer_reviews.author: NJ Gifted

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Used for pro signature at a signing. Loved it. Used silver paint pen to help it stand out. The glove is beautiful darker color! Decent price for what we were intending.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good glove right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I got this catchers glove because I teach girls from 6 to 18 windmill pitching. Until they get to 8 or 9 you can catch them with a fielders mitt, but the older girls can really bring it and my hand couldn’t take the punishment. The first day the glove was very comfortable and relatively usable. I plan on oiling it and beating it with a 5/lb hammer a while, and I think it will get even better. I was very impressed with it right out of the box. My hand isn’t numb tonight 😉
customer_reviews.author: katherine a isenberg

customer_reviews.title: Basic catchers glove
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for basic catchers glove- this is a decent choice. In hindsight, I wished I would've spent a little more money and bougtht something with better quality padding, leather and stitching. Bought online and didn't try it on first - my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful glove
customer_reviews.text: I like how the glove fits and that it has a Velcro strap to tighten it to your wrist/hand. Plus I like that it is a Rawlings glove cause they are good gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Snow

customer_reviews.title: Nice so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this glove (it's a catcher's glove) oiled and wrapped up for two weeks breaking it in. Smells great and fits snug. Haven't used it much but it seems to be a nice product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: King Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Not as soft as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: This glove is definitely not near broken in as some suggest here. It does run small as others say but I have smaller hands so it works out.
customer_reviews.author: Rayboy

customer_reviews.title: Great softball glove
customer_reviews.text: Great glove. Great adult size softball glove. Nothing fancy nor glitzy just good solid functionality. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stalls

customer_reviews.title: Velcro strap at the wrist continually popped off during use ...
customer_reviews.text: Velcro strap at the wrist continually popped off during use; had to return it, not sure if this was a one-off or a common occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not good for softball despite description
customer_reviews.text: Very irritated as I can longer return this item but it was advertised as baseball & softball catchers mitt. However, pocket is not big enough for softball. You really should allow more time for returns during Covid since customers have to order things so early now due to shipping delays.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Odle

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: The look and feel of the glove is great especially for the price point. It also came in broken in slightly not to stiff and serviceable out of the box (Might Vary I have strong hands) . I've only used a few times so I can not contest to how durable it is but if last a while then its a 5 star in my book with the price point. If I remember after the season I will update the durability.
customer_reviews.author: KP42

customer_reviews.title: Super glove
customer_reviews.text: Someone stole my 30 + yr old glove. This wonderful glove easily replaces it. Very little work is required to break it in.
customer_reviews.author: David Randall

customer_reviews.title: Did not take much to break-in.
customer_reviews.text: With a little pre-work I was comfortably use in a game. Another team mate was impressed with it and had me order him one.,..he is also quite pleased with the break-in .
customer_reviews.author: Bob Popovich

customer_reviews.title: You have to see it in person
customer_reviews.text: Such a BEAUTIFUL glove! My son is first year player in high school and loves it! He is 5'11 and 210lbs.. big hands. It fit great!
customer_reviews.author: hylifavrd

product_meta.title: Rawlings Player Preferred Adult Baseball/Softball Glove Series
product_meta.description: Made with quality, full grain oiled leather shells and all leather laces for durability and strength
feature_bullets: 12 1/2 inch slow pitch adult baseball glove great for recreational Baseball and Softball games
Zero shock palm padding for increased impact protection while catching
Quick and easy break in for a game ready feel. Pro micro lining
Conventional back with a flex loop velcro strap for an easily adjustable fit
Basket web allows you to play nearly any position in the field
Right hand throw = left hand glove, left hand throw = right hand glove
Right Hand Orientation = Right Hand Throw / Left Hand Orientation = Left Hand Throw
